1.title: Dat Car
1.plot: Richard Rawlings searches the far-flung corners of Texas for forgotten and derelict classic cars to buy and restore at the Gas Monkey Garage in Dallas.

2.title: Tune It Up
2.plot: As the Monkeys and guest builder Big Mike race to get their '75 Datsun 280Z ready, a missing part may stop Richard from debuting Gas Monkeys first-ever tuner car at SEMA.

3.title: Shining Up a '59 F-100
3.plot: When a big-name client wants Gas Monkey to build them a promotional vehicle on spec, Richard bets they'll take a shine to a custom '59 Ford F-100.

4.title: Monkeying Around
4.plot: Richard and the Monkeys mess around at Gas Monkey Garage, checking out builds like the 4x4 Camaro and the Firebirds #1 and #2

5.title: Shiny and New
5.plot: Richard's gamble of building a '59 Ford F-100 promotional vehicle on spec for a brewery may pay off to the tune $150,000 - but only if they like the end result.

6.title: Trouble in the Galaxie
6.plot: Richard's plan for a straightforward upgrade on a '62 Ford Galaxie goes south when the Monkeys discover the worst body panel they've ever seen after it returns from sandblasting.

7.title: Richard's Guide to the Galaxies
7.plot: The Monkeys' bad decisions on their '62 Galaxie build could jeopardise Richard's plan to take it to auction. Can only Richard's old nemesis fix the interior?

8.title: The Bass is Back
8.plot: Brian Bass rejoins the Gas Monkeys as Richard plans to resurrect the iconic '92 Chevy 3500 Dually - known as the "Krew Kut" - to reveal at the Lone Star Throwdown.

9.title: The Cutting Krew
9.plot: Richard's plan to reveal the Krew Kut Dually at the Lone Star Throwdown hits a snag when rain forces him to come up with a new plan to re-introduce it to its fans.

1.title: Model A Madness
1.plot: SERIES PREMIERE - Richard and Aaron find the hot rod of their dreams: a rust-free 1931 Model A . As renovation costs pile up, Richard looks to make some fast cash with a couple of quick flips, including the "Drive Angry" Riviera and a Chevy 210.

2.title: Awesome Aussies and Olds
2.plot: Richard and Aaron find a '55 Chevy Bel Air as well as a 1950 Oldsmobile Coupe Rocket 88, which had been perfectly preserved in a garage for over 50 years. They have 48 hours to fix up a broken-down '73 Caddy convertible for two Aussies hitting Route 66.

3.title: Monkey Business Dragster
3.plot: Richard and Aaron stumble upon a diamond in the rough: a 1960s Gasser that Richard wants to race. They buy a gleaming '32 Pontiac at a swap meet. And is a friend's 1960 Cadillac Sedan De Ville haunted and cursing the garage?

4.title: Double Trouble Galaxie
4.plot: When the rebuild of a '64 Galaxie goes bad, Richard races to find a suitable replacement for an auction he's already committed to. A '49 F-1 Ford arrives on the car hauler, but getting it off proves to be a big problem.

5.title: Low Riding Lincoln
5.plot: Richard and Aaron turn the granddaddy of big cars, a 1970 Lincoln Continental Mark III, into a muscle car and bring a '68 Ford pickup back to life. Richard scoops up a 1970s style hot rod it car with a mysterious past.

6.title: Amazing Impala
6.plot: Richard, Aaron, and the Gas monkey crew unbury a '64 Impala buried in 10 years of debris and bring it back to life. A 1951 Bruco Fire Truck sparks former firefighter Richard's fancy as does a 1955 Caddy Coupe de Ville nicknamed Dolly.

7.title: Frankensteined Ford
7.plot: The Gas Monkey crew patch together two vehicles to make a Frankensteined '68 Ford F-100 truck. Richard buys a '77 Trans Am Firebird as he relives the days of his youth. He flips a '67 Caddy convertible to a Swedish buyer.

8.title: Ramshackle Rambler
8.plot: Richard and Aaron purchase a 1959 Rambler Super which has been rotting away in a field for years. Richard has his friend Tom pickup a 1941 Willis Coupe Gasser which could earn him a 6 figure sum if he can prove a link between the vehicle and a famous drag racing team.

9.title: '48 Chevy Fleetmaster
9.plot: Richard and Aaron find a '48 Chevy Fleetmaster at a swap meet. The Gas Monkey crew can't get over how ugly this purple beast looks. Richard picks up a customized '74 Corvette. In Oklahoma, Richard puts the Fleetmaster and a '63 Caddy in front of a tough auction crowd for a "No Reserve" sale.

10.title: One of a Kind Woodhill
10.plot: Richard buys a rare '53 Woodill Wildfire. The Gas Monkey crew have to handle this fragile and flammable fiberglass-bodied sports car with extreme care as Richard expects to make his first six-figure sale. The crew piece together a project Harley motorcycle and they get to some fun down-time watching Richard enter in a Demolition Derby.

11.title: Fast & Furious Fairmount
11.plot: Richard and Aaron close a deal on an "ugly" '78 Ford Fairmont that they decide to turn into a chromed drift car. Richard flips a rare '67 Corvette which comes complete with the tank sticker and a customer who wants to buy the shop truck agrees to wager five grand of the asking price in a driving skill test against Richard.

12.title: Holy Grail Hot Rod
12.plot: Richard and Aaron pick up a very rare '32 Ford 3-window, but when they get it back to the shop they have a blow up about what they should do with it. Richard gets first option to buy his tattooist's '64 Econoline van for a "Swag Wagon". A donated '89 Shelby pickup leaves Richard in a quandary but Christie comes up with a great idea.

13.title: Apache/Road to Chopper Live
13.plot: Richard picks up a '59 Chev Apache Shortbed truck in need of some Gas Monkey love. One of the monkey mechanics resigns so he can start his own business leaving Richard one man down at a time when he can't afford it. Richard finds a '64 Lincoln on the old "interweb" and does his shirt on the deal. The Gas Monkeys are invited to the biker build off against Paul Snr, Paul Jnr and Jessie James.

14.title: Apache/Road to Chopper Live: Part 2
14.plot: Amongst the biker build off shenanigans, GMG gets a steaming delivery from Jesse James. Richard and Aaron locate a '68 Shelby Mustang GT350 which is full of rust and decide on a quick flip. The Apache truck rebuild misses the auction but Richard has luck with a walk in buyer.

1.title: Mashed Up Mustang
1.plot: Richard trades his friend a '58 Impala for a '67 Mustang. He flips a '72 Pontiac Formula 400, but will it make up for his most embarrassing purchase yet?

2.title: Bad Ass Bronco: Part 1
2.plot: Richard and Aaron take on a '76 Bronco but unfortunately runaway rust issues make this project budget-buster. Needing cash fast, Richard hits the road in search of some quick flips.

3.title: Bad Ass Bronco: Part 2
3.plot: With the Bronco over-budget and past deadline, Richard's patience (and wallet) are severely tested. He sells a '36 Ford three-window then considers a dare to sell his beloved Shelby Mustang.

4.title: Far-Out Fairlane
4.plot: Richard and Aaron resurrect two cars bought from a local charity: a '59 Fairlane 500 Galaxie and a 1954 Bel Air. Richard is concerned for his safety at a Model A bone yard, but it's having to reject one of Sue's jobs that has him and Aaron most concerned.

5.title: Stung By a '67 Corvette Stingray
5.plot: A side trip to Vegas nets Richard and Aaron casino winnings and Evel Knievel's Messerschmitt microcar. Later Richard buys a 73 Dodge Challenger and the Holy Grail of Corvettes: a '67 Stingray in hopes of a 6-figure sale, but Aaron is not pleased...at all.

6.title: Trials of a T-Bird
6.plot: Richard and Aaron bring a hot '58 Corvette home to the new Gas Monkey World Headquarters. Christie takes a gamble, buying a '65 T-Bird while Richard is away. Model Alloy Ash fires up her welding torch to prove to Aaron she's more than just a pretty face.

7.title: Ferocious Ford and Fast Ferrari
7.plot: The Gas Monkey crew turn a rat-infested '38 Ford into a cool hot rod. Richard buys football player Emmitt Smith's Mercedes, which comes with a surprise. Is new female welder Alloy up for the GMG challenge? Richard gambles $400K on a banged up Ferrari F-40.

1.title: Ferrari Fix Part 1: Dead Head Bus
1.plot: Invested over their heads in a wrecked Ferrari F-40 Richard, Aaron and the crew embark on the riskiest - and most expensive -- build in Gas Monkey history. To recoup costs they flip a '58 Corvette C1 and a time capsule Dead Head tour bus.

2.title: Ferrari Fix Part 2: 1917 REO
2.plot: The GMG crew go all out to finish the Ferrari F40 rebuild. A broken $8000 windshield makes Richard regret taking on the project, until a parts delivery driver in high heels catches his eye. Richard's luck turns when the '67 Porsche 911S he buys turns out to be rare find worth more than he anticipated. Tom has one day to get crankin' on a 1917 REO and make it ready for auction.

3.title: No Bull Bonneville
3.plot: The road tripping Aussies are coming back and Richard has 72 hours to prepare a '59 Bonneville for their latest trip. Enter the Keagle. To get some more cash for the job, Richard snatches a bulk buy; a '67 Mercedes, a '50 Bel Air, a '54 Hudson Metropolitan and a '64 Autobianchi.

4.title: Dodge Hodge Podge Part 1, '65 Mustang
4.plot: Richard and Aaron buy and rebuild a '64 Dodge Sweptline pickup truck.

5.title: Dodge Hodge Podge Part 2/Oldsmobile Delta 88
5.plot: The crew struggles to finish the frankensteined 64 Dodge truck. Richard flips a 52 Chevy. He digs out an Oldsmobile Delta 88 he forgot he bought but it's also not quite what he remembered. Broke brakes leave a dent in the garage door and Richard's wallet.

6.title: Ford Galaxie: Part 1/Bikini Contest
6.plot: Richard and Aaron travel to Roswell to pick up a '67 Ford Galaxie. Then it's off to LA where Richard buys a '32 Plymouth and is excited to make a rare '51 Nash Healey deal. Finally, a former customer invites Richard and Aaron to Denver to be guest judges at a bikini contest for his restaurant chain. When Richard leaves for home, Aaron goes MIA and misses the plane.

7.title: Ford Galaxie: Part 2/Nash Healey
7.plot: With Aaron still missing in Denver, the Gas Monkey crew works to get the Ford Galaxie restored. Richard takes Tom to an auction with Evel Knievel's Messerschmitt. Richard tries to sell Dennis his Nash Healey, knowing that Dennis already owns a perfectly restored serial number one Nash Healey worth an estimated seven figures. Christie gets crank calls from a guy claiming to be Dale Earnhardt Jr.

8.title: Beards, Builds and Beers
8.plot: Richard, Aaron, Sue and the Gas Monkeys revisit this series flips, respond to some fan email and fill in some missing moments that missed the series shows.

1.title: Dale Jr.'s Sick Nomad
1.plot: Dale Earnhardt Jr asks Richard and Aaron to build him a 1956 Chevy Nomad and gives them a 10 day schedule. The GMG crew find a way to cool off in the Texas heat, but when Richard returns he quickly gets them back to work. Richard does a quick flip on a pumpkin colored Pantera.

2.title: Chopped Cabriolet and 'Vette Rescue
2.plot: Richard receives a call from a lady who wants to sell her late husband's car collection, a Ford '32 Cabriolet and various other hot rod projects. They rescue an badly neglected '62 Corvette from a garage on the verge of falling down. Richard calls the Monkeys together for a big announcement. Is it the end of the GMG, or another expansion?

3.title: Cool Customline
3.plot: When K.C. breaks down in his beloved '55 Ford Customline, he calls Richard for a tow. Richard buys the car and flips it after an "all out" restore. George Foreman drives off in Richard's prize Mustang. Richard and Dennis do a deal with a WW2 veteran for a '38 Aston Martin and some Nashes.

4.title: Killer COPO Camaro
4.plot: Richard gets his hands dirty building a $100K 2013 COPO Camaro from the wheels up on the VIP assembly line. Aaron ignores his request to work on a newly arrived 1930 Model A. Instead, Aaron builds his own dream vehicle while the Monkeys tackle the A.

5.title: Caddy Rust Bucket/Bel-Air Beauty Part 1
5.plot: Richard buys a nest of cars including a '68 Cadillac Coupe de Ville that is so rusted out that Aaron and the guys want to mutiny, but not until they have a little fun with it first. Can Richard and Dennis save a piece of racing history from the crusher?

6.title: Caddy Rust Bucket/Bel-Air Beauty Part 2
6.plot: Rust-ridden Caddy dumped, Richard gambles that the GMG crew can recoup his losses with a '60 Bel Air. Christie talks money -- first with a dad who wants to punk his teenage son with a Yugo and then with Richard trying to convince him to hire his sister.

7.title: Flugtag Flyer/Wicked Wayfarer
7.plot: GMG takes wing! Aaron builds a flying machine for the Red Bull Flugtag event and the team launches him off a 30ft pier. But will the Gas Monkey Flying Circus take off or take a nose dive? Meanwhile, the crew brings a rare 1950 Dodge Wayfarer back to life.

8.title: '71 Cool Kingswood/Retro Replicar
8.plot: The crew turns an ugly duckling 71 Chevy Kingwood station wagon into the cool, 70s hot rod dragster it was meant to be. Richard pries an 80 MG Replicar from a husband reluctant to part with it. The Grill books its 1st celebrity musical act.

9.title: Shelby Rent-A-Racer Resto, Part 1
9.plot: The crew takes on a '68 Shelby Mustang that looks sweet but what's it hiding? Richard flips his lid when Tom and Jordan buy two junker cars from two tourists. Richard and KC travel to a secret lair to make a deal on a Lotus Cortina and an amphibicar.

10.title: Shelby Rent-A-Racer Resto, Part 2
10.plot: Engine issues plague the '68 Shelby. Richard flips the rare '66 Lotus Cortina and floating Amphicar for some fast cash. A classic Ford Falcon arrives at the garage -- and selling it would be icing on the cake.

11.title: Fast N' Loud Meets the Bandit
11.plot: Richard is hired by a wheeler-dealer friend to build a "Smokey & The Bandit" '77 Trans Am. He and Aaron have six days to build and get the car to New Orleans in time for the buyer to race in a rally. Some original Bandit stars help sweeten the deal.

12.title: Fast N' Loud Meets the Bandit: Part 2
12.plot: Richard and Aaron reach Burt Reynolds and win their wager, but that success may mean ultimate failure when the team doesn't get the '77 Trans Am on a transporter in time. Solution: they'll race it down to the New Orleans starting line themselves.

13.title: Troll's Choice Rolls-Royce
13.plot: When Richard "accidentally" buys $92K worth of cars at an auction, his bookkeeper sister insists he flip all five cars in one week. Some go more easily and profitably than others but it's a weirdly built Rolls Royce that even Aaron has a hard time fixing.

14.title: Aaron's Falcon Racecar
14.plot: Aaron falls in love with and buys a famous '63 Ford Falcon race car off Richard. But will the original owner be impressed by Aaron's Gas Monkey style? While Aaron's tied up in his passion project, Richard flips a 1919 Nash and an unusually painted truck.

15.title: Mustang Mania
15.plot: Aaron chances the wrath of the Big Monkey when he overrides Richard's instructions on a Mustang Fastback. After picking up a "Holy Grail" Boss 429 Mustang in Minnesota, Richard questions Dennis's decision to buy a rustbucket Jaguar E-type buried in snow.

16.title: Jacked-up Jeep
16.plot: Aaron and the Gas Monkey crew overhaul a Jeep in 24 hours to surprise a friend. Richard flips a funky gull-winged Bricklin. Daphne convinces a reluctant Richard to hire his nephew. Dennis and Richard argue over how best to sell their COPO Camaros.

17.title: Fleetline Superflip Frenzy
17.plot: It's a Gas Monkey Fire Sale when Richard quick flips a menagerie of cars to make enough cash to buy back the first car he and Aaron built together 10 years ago. Richard and Dennis literally roll the dice on a 57 Chevy back in snowy Minnesota.

18.title: Demolition Theater
18.plot: Richard and Aaron cringe along with you while watching some seriously epic fails--from hapless drivers unable to control their vehicles to a hotrodder who catches his engine and self on fire. Richard even has his own cringe-worthy moment in a stunt plane.

19.title: Holy Grail Firebirds - Part 1
19.plot: Richard makes a risky deal to restore the first two Firebirds ever made from rusted and rough to museum quality. The buyer offers a handsome deal, but it comes with a crushing deadline and a 10K/day penalty for every day he's late. Aaron learns to race.

20.title: Holy Grail Firebirds: Part 2
20.plot: With a 10K-a-day penalty looming, Richard can't afford to lose any more time on the two Firebirds' concourse restoration, but by the end of the project, the garage will be short two Monkeys. Richard flips a '49 Mercury that comes complete with passenger.

21.title: Fast Moving F-100
21.plot: Aaron's not impressed by the '72 Ford Pantera Richard picks up, but he and the Monkeys have fun bringing a Ford F100 truck back to life. Then, they head to Tennessee to try to buy back two pieces of Gas Monkey history: a ratrod and a panhead motorcycle.

1.title: Chopped and Dropped Model A, Part I
1.plot: Aaron and Richard find themselves a 1931 Model A to chop! What begins as a simple build quickly grows into a grand green machine. With less than a month to build this chromed out 60's show car from the ground up, Richard's wild plan may be too much.

2.title: Chopped and Dropped Model A, Part II
2.plot: When Richard snaps back to his senses, he puts the monkeys back on track and they must finish the '31 Chopped Model A in ten days. It doesn't go without a lot of strife. Meanwhile, Richard and Dennis argue over a holy grail find of a 64 ½ Mustang.

4.title: Super Sonic Camaro, Part II
4.plot: When Richard lands his biggest deal in Gas Monkey history, his crew struggles to hit Sonic Drive-In's deadline. Meanwhile, Christie and Richard spar over losing an auction bid. Tensions are high and it doesn't look like anyone's going to come out on top.

5.title: Pikes Peak Pace Truck Part II
5.plot: Pikes Peak International Hill Climb is 3 days away and the C10 pace truck is nowhere near being complete. Aaron struggles to keep the Falcon damage free as he approaches the race of his life. Richard also finds some old employees stepping into his territory.

6.title: Pikes Peak or Bust, Part I
6.plot: As Aaron prepares for the Pikes Peak International Race, he learns that his Falcon still has some work to be. Then Aaron springs on Richard that they have 3 weeks to build a Pace Race Truck for Pikes Peak. Meanwhile, Richard lands a sweet '31 Model A.

7.title: The Shorty Short VW Bus; Fired Up About a '67 Chevelle
7.plot: When Richard buys a VW Microbus no one really knows the mechanics of this German car. Later, Richard and Aaron discover that the Fired Up garage is attending a demolition derby and Richard has a trick up his sleeve to send his former employees reeling.

10.title: One Cool Impala, Fired Up About a Chevelle Part II
10.plot: When Richard buys a '65 Chevy Impala, they put their Gas Monkey spin on it. Richard and Aaron score a '34 Five Window Ford. And later, Richard agrees to cool off the monkeys with new air conditioning, but the Fired Up crew gets hot and bothered about it.

11.title: Big, Bad C-10 Build, Part I
11.plot: Richard and Aaron build their coolest hot rod, a 1976 Chevy C-10 short bed show truck to be auctioned at the Cattle Baron's Ball. Plus, Richard misses out on a Firebird thanks to Thomas Weeks, and a 65 Cadillac is on the lot for one of Richard's buyers.

12.title: Big, Bad C-10 Build, Part II
12.plot: The plan to build Gas Monkey's coolest show truck continues as Richard hopes to deliver a 1976 Chevy C-10 to the Cattle Baron's Ball. Meanwhile,Richard tries to flip a '66 Continental and a '51 Caddy. Also, Richard stops by Fired Up to check on the rent.

13.title: NHRA and a '55 Pink Caddy Part I
13.plot: When Richard gets a deal to build a '55 Pink Caddy for a 100 grand, it all seems like a sweet deal. Until the monkeys relay that they may not be able to build the car in time for the tight deadline. Meanwhile, Richard invests in sponsoring and NHRA team.

14.title: NHRA and a '55 Pink Caddy Part II
14.plot: After a constant wait for parts for the '55 Pink Caddy, the monkeys make a mad dash to get the car done on time. Meanwhile, Richard ventures into new territory as his Gas Monkey Dragster hits the Texas Motorplex for the NHRA qualifying runs.

16.title: Don't Hassle the Hoff: Pontiac Trans Am Part I
16.plot: When an old friend of Richard's offers him $200,000 for a Knight Rider KITT car and for David Hasselhoff to appear at his 40th birthday party, Richard can't pass up this offer. He sets out to not only find an 80's Trans Am, but the Hoff.

17.title: Don't Hassle the Hoff: Pontiac Trans Am Part II
17.plot: It's a race against time as the Monkeys rush to finish the KITT car. Richard's on edge because he's worried that him and Aaron might not make it to the Las Vegas birthday party with the car by the deadline. They also don't know if the Hoff will show up.

21.title: Outlaws All Over
21.plot: Richard has invited his friends Farmtruck and Azn from "Street Outlaws" to check out his favorite viral videos. A double decker car flip is almost a huge flop. A man attaches a string to himself with a staple gun. And don't miss the clip of the week...

1.title: Scat Pack Challenger Part 1
1.plot: Richard and Aaron transform a vintage '71 Dodge Scat Pack Challenger by using the power of a 2015 Scat Pack Challenger under the hood. Richard invests in a concert venue and a '57 Shorty School bus gets a makeover with hilarious results.

2.title: Scat Pack Challenger Part 2
2.plot: Aaron and his team attempt to get the '71 Challenger build to accept the 2015 Challenger technology. In the process, they create a one of a kind resto/mod. Richard buys a busted up '34 Plymouth and the crew takes the '57 Shorty bus for a test drive.

3.title: Back to the 80's in a '68 Coronet
3.plot: Richard buys a '69 Malibu only to realize there are massive issues. Aaron crashes into a '68 Coronet on the GMG lot. Richard travels to St. Louis to buy a tricked out '79 Camaro. Motley Crue performs at Gas Monkey Live grand opening.

4.title: Road to Barrett Jackson Part I
4.plot: Richard sells the '79 Camaro to prepare for Barrett Jackson, the biggest auction of the year. Aaron's team builds a '68 Impala while Richard and Dennis buy a '64 Corvette Stingray. Richard pulls the '66 VW bus, '69 F100 truck and '76 C10 to auction.

5.title: Road to Barrett Jackson Part 2/NHRA
5.plot: It's showtime at Barrett Jackson with wheeling-and-dealing throughout the week showcasing the excitement. Richard's Stingray arrives just in time for the start of the auction. Meanwhile, Aaron attends NHRA in Vegas to see how team Gas Monkey performs.

6.title: Rocking '76 G10 Van
6.plot: Richard and Aaron take on a different build when they decide to transform a $300 find on the side of the road into a '76 Exploration Van.The Dale Earnhardt '56 Nomad makes an appearance back at the shop, as KC and his team are tasked with fixing the body.

1.title: Year of the Monkey
1.plot: Before beginning a new season building even bigger and better cars, Richard and Aaron gather the Monkeys to remember the ups and downs of the last year.

2.title: Cutlass Lowrider, Part 1
2.plot: Richard buys a '78 Cutlass so Aaron can build Gas Monkey's first ever lowrider, only to discover that Aaron's plan to create custom hydraulics is something he's never attempted before.

3.title: Cutlass Lowrider, Part 2
3.plot: As Richard heads to Houston to check out Gas Monkey's top fuel NHRA dragster do some racing, the Monkeys need to do some racing of their own to finish a custom lowrider paint job on the '78 Cutlass in time for the car's debut.

4.title: Big Red Caddy, Part 1
4.plot: Richard and Aaron decide bigger is better, giving a red '67 Cadillac convertible the luxury treatment in a risky bid to attract a higher caliber of buyers.

5.title: Big Red Caddy, Part 2
5.plot: With a big-time buyer already on the way, engine and upholstery problems threaten to derail Richard and Aaron's red '67 Cadillac convertible.

6.title: Supping Up a Super Ford GT, Part 1
6.plot: When Richard brings a smashed up 2005 Ford GT back to the shop with the intention of making a quick repair for a fast profit, Aaron talks him into giving it the full Gas Monkey treatment.

7.title: Supping Up a Super Ford GT, Part 2
7.plot: As work on the smashed up 2005 Ford GT continues, Richard heads to Indiana to try to sell a Shelby Cobra prop car used in the superhero movie Iron Man.

8.title: Racing a '67 Dodge Dart, Part 1
8.plot: When Richard receives a drag race challenge from a couple of Internet upstarts, he changes gears on his big '67 Dart build to transform it into the ultimate dragster.

9.title: Racing a '67 Dodge Dart, Part 2
9.plot: With engine problems on the Dart threatening to stop their big drag race with Roadkill before it starts, Richard and Aaron could face epic humiliation in front of millions of fans.

10.title: Frustrated with a '32 Ford; Return to Pikes Peak, Part 1
10.plot: Richard buys a '32 5-Window Ford Coupe planning for an easy build for the Monkeys while Aaron's away racing at Pikes Peak, but fate and fortune have other ideas.

11.title: Frustrated with a '32 Ford; Return to Pikes Peak, Part 2
11.plot: The '32 5-Window Ford Coupe Richard bought as an easy build for the Monkeys continues giving them problems, as weather and car issues threaten to derail Aaron's trip to Pikes Peak.

12.title: Motorcycle Mayhem/Packing a Packard for Pebble, Part 1
12.plot: When Richard's '29 Packard receives an invitation to the fabled Concours d'Elegance at Pebble Beach, he challenges the Monkeys to a motorcycle build-off to keep them busy while he's away.

13.title: Motorcycle Mayhem/Packing a Packard for Pebble, Part 2
13.plot: When Richard's '29 Packard receives an invitation to the fabled Concours d'Elegance at Pebble Beach, he challenges the Monkeys to a motorcycle build-off to keep them busy while he's away.

14.title: Revving Up a '69 Riviera
14.plot: Auction fever hits the garage as the Monkeys have less than a week to build a '69 Riviera to sell at the Leake Auction along with motorcycles from their big chopper build off to determine who will win Richard's big prize.

1.title: Parked in the Keys
1.plot: After building and selling more cars than they can count, Richard and Aaron hit the beach for a much needed break so they can finally answer some of the questions and comments their fans have sent in over the years.

2.title: Harley and Me
2.plot: Richard buys Aaron a 1942 Harley-Davidson WLA '45 with the aim of rebuilding the bike appropriate to its original era in order to participate in a vintage race on the New Jersey shore in just two weeks.

0.title: Social Intervention
0.plot: Richard and Aaron gather the Monkeys so they can answer more of the many comments and questions their fans from all over the world have sent in over the years.

2.title: Hot Off the Pantera
2.plot: Looking to make a big debut at an all new Barrett Jackson auction in eight weeks, Richard buys into Aaron's plan to build a '72 Pantera fitted with a custom turbocharged Ford EcoBoost V6 engine.

3.title: Pan-tera's Labyrinth
3.plot: A last minute problem arises with the turbo-charged EcoBoost '72 Ford Pantera Aaron is building for the new Barrett-Jackson Northeast, which in turn, forces Richard to gamble by bringing his quarter-million dollar 2005 Ford GT to the auction instead.

4.title: The Pickup Artist
4.plot: Richard and Aaron set an ambitious deadline of just six weeks to turn an old '49 Chevy pickup into a show-quality truck in time to debut at the big Lone Star Throwdown.

5.title: Pickup the Pieces
5.plot: Richard and Aaron's goal of turning an old '49 Chevy pickup into a show-quality truck comes down to the wire as they race to finish it in time to debut at the Lone Star Throwdown.

6.title: Camaro Rising
6.plot: After a number of tough builds, Richard decides to do something nice for Aaron and the Monkeys. Richard buys a '67 Camaro mounted on a K5 chassis hoping the Camaro will lift their spirits.

7.title: Porsche 9-1-1
7.plot: Aaron's idea to build a "junkyard Porsche" capable of going head-to-head against Richard's 2015 Porsche 911 Turbo S goes awry when the expensive conversion kits he's bought don't fit as planned.

8.title: Escaping the Zoo
8.plot: With more builds and flips under their belts than they can count, Richard and Aaron gather up a few of their biggest fans to find out what happened to some of Gas Monkey's more memorable cars.

9.title: Wheels of Fortune
9.plot: Richard and Aaron take on a challenge from Hot Wheels to create a life-sized car to become part of their exclusive Red Line Club. Later, Aaron reveals his choice for the build is a 1963 Ford Econoline truck.

1.title: Million Dollar Monkey
1.plot: Aaron heads to Pike's Peak, while the guys build a 1955 Chevy that Richard plans to sell at a Barrett-Jackson auction on the East Coast.

2.title: Opening Bid
2.plot: As Richard gets ready to sell a million dollars worth of cars at the Barret-Jackson auction, problems arise with his '55 Chevy threatening to keep him from taking it to the auction.

3.title: When Lightning Strikes
3.plot: Banking on a speedy build because of all the aftermarket parts available for G-body cars, Aaron bets Richard he can finish a 1980 El Camino in three weeks instead of four.

4.title: La Casa Del Camino
4.plot: After Aaron bets Richard that the Monkeys would be able to finish building a 1980 El Camino one week ahead of schedule, last-minute problems threaten to push them past their deadline.

5.title: Buggin Out
5.plot: Aaron and the crew take on a VW Beetle build. Richard meets Phipps to try make a cheap deal on a truck. Dennis and Richard head out to the desert to buy some rare cars to restore.

6.title: The Vomit Comet
6.plot: With Aaron off on vacation, Richard tasks the Monkeys with giving the Gas Monkey treatment to the first car he ever owned back in high school, a vomit green '74 Mercury Comet.

7.title: Bye Bye Beardy/Build to Mega Race Part 1
7.plot: The Street Outlaws throw down a gauntlet. Meanwhile, Aaron returns to the garage with some news.

8.title: Build to Mega Race Part 2
8.plot: With race day against the Street Outlaws fast approaching, Aaron struggles to get his BMW ready on his own while Richard faces potential disaster when the Challenger crashes on its final test run.

9.title: 100 Monkeys
9.plot: Richard and Aaron host a party to celebrate 100 episodes of Fast 'n Loud.

10.title: Fast N So Long
10.plot: Richard and Aaron get together to look back at their partnership as Aaron prepares to say his final goodbye to Fast n' Loud.

1.title: Step Vanning Into a New Era
1.plot: It's the beginning of a new era at Gas Monkey Garage as Richard puts the Monkeys in charge of hot-rodding a '73 Chevy P30 Step Van for their first big build without Aaron.

2.title: Crusin' for a Bruisin
2.plot: As the Monkeys race to finish their first big build without Aaron, Richard tries to unload his '65 Shelby Mustang GT with a frozen engine.

3.title: All About the Bass
3.plot: Richard brings in Gas Monkey's first ever guest builder as Dallas hot-rodder Brian Bass teams up with the Monkeys to build a '60's style hot rod out of a '34 Ford Coupe.

4.title: Bad Bass
4.plot: As the Monkeys and guest builder Brian Bass go over schedule on their '34 Ford Coupe, Richard strikes a deal to feature the car in Hot Rod Magazine if it can be finished in time.

5.title: All About the Bad Bass

6.title: Busch vs. Logano
6.plot: Richard Rawlings makes a deal with 2017 Daytona 500 winner Kurt Busch when he visits Gas Monkey Garage in Dallas to build a 200hp 1972 Pantera for him that he can race against fellow NASCAR champion Joey Logano.

7.title: The Race: Busch vs. Logano
7.plot: Richard and the Monkeys push to finish Kurt Busch's custom '72 Pantera in time for his grudge race against fellow NASCAR superstar Joey Logano and his Factory 5 Shelby Daytona.

imdb.plot outline: These guys cruise for the classics. Meet self-described petrol-sexual motorhead Richard Rawlings and mechanical prodigy Aaron Kaufmann as they search far-flung corners of the country for forgotten and derelict classic cars to restore at their Gas Monkey Garage. Heaps of rust are transformed into gleaming road warriors and sold to the top bidder.
imdb.title: Fast N' Loud
plot: These guys cruise for the classics. Meet self-described petrol-sexual motorhead Richard Rawlings and mechanical prodigy Aaron Kaufmann as they search far-flung corners of the country for forgotten and derelict classic cars to restore at their Gas Monkey Garage. Heaps of rust are transformed into gleaming road warriors and sold to the top bidder.::Discovery

_Fast N' Loud_ (qv) follows motor mastermind Richard Rawlings and mechanical whiz kid Aaron Kaufmann as they search the far flung corners of Texas and beyond for beat-up, classic cars they can buy and restore at their home base, Gas Monkey Garage, in Dallas. While 'in Rome,' they'll fall in with the local customs and characters - an all American road trip with full throttle attitude. Ultimately, Richard and Aaron will do whatever it takes to finish their cars and make auction. But will their blood, sweat and beers translate into cold hard cash?::Coolfire Originals
